revised_title: Anatomy of the Human Voice and its Mechanism
tldr: This article discusses the intricate anatomy and functioning of the human voice. It explains the roles of various structures, such as the trachea, thyroid gland, pharynx, and larynx, in producing sound and articulating speech. The author also describes the actions of muscles and nerves in controlling the voice and highlights the differences between vowels, consonants, and explosive sounds. Furthermore, the article explores the causes of speech disorders like stammering and the effects of accidents and diseases on voice production.
